column1: Campi Bisenzio is a comune (municipality) in the Metropolitan City of Florence in the Italian region Tuscany
column2: located about 10 kilometres (6 mi) northwest of Florence.

column1: The word Campi in the municipality's name stems from the fields which are widespread in the lands around the town. The current name of Campi Bisenzio was assumed only in 1862
column2: with the addition of the name of the Bisenzio river that runs through the town.Campi Bisenzio is the place where the internal combustion engine was built for the first time by Felice Matteucci and father Eugenio Barsanti.

column1: A number of Renaissance artworks from the church of Sant'Andrea a San Donnino are housed in its adjacent museum.
The church of Santa Maria a Campi Bisenzio still maintains many of its original artworks.
